Gradient descent convergence bound

If we run GD for Tâ‰¥R2G2Ïµ2T \geq \frac{R^2 G^2}{\epsilon^2} iterations then f(ğ±Ì‚)â‰¤f(ğ±*)+Ïµf(\mathbf{\hat{x}}) \leq f(\mathbf{x^*}) + \epsilon

If we run GD for Tâ‰¥R2G2Ïµ2T \geq \frac{R^2 G^2}{\epsilon^2} iterations with step-size Î·=RGT\eta = \frac{R}{G \sqrt{T}} then f(ğ±Ì‚)â‰¤f(ğ±*)+Ïµf(\mathbf{\hat{x}}) \leq f(\mathbf{x^*}) + \epsilon

(Projected) Gradient descent returns ğ±Ì‚\hat{\mathbf{x}} with f(ğ±Ì‚)â‰¤minğ±âˆˆğ’®f(ğ±)+Ïµf(\hat{\mathbf{x}}) \leq \min_{\mathbf{x} \in \mathcal{S}} f(\mathbf{x}) + \epsilon after T=R2G2Ïµ2T = \frac{R^2 G^2}{\epsilon^2} iterations.

Proof
